Package voltage.processors

Class EnvelopeFollower

java.lang.Object
voltage.processors.EnvelopeFollower
public class EnvelopeFollower
extends java.lang.Object
An envelope follower outputs a voltage that measures how loud an incoming audio signal is. For example, a very loud drum part could be triggering a lot, but if you happened to sample it while it was crossing a zero threshold, you would be showing an amplitude of zero when that is not indicative of the loudness.

  • Constructor Details

    • EnvelopeFollower

      public EnvelopeFollower​(double initialAttackMils, double initialReleaseMils, double initialValue)
      Constructs an EnvelopeFollower
      Parameters:
      initialAttackMils - the time in milliseconds that it takes to rise up to the input signal.
      initialReleaseMils - the time in milliseconds that it takes to fall back down to 0.
      initialValue - a default starting value.

  • Method Details

    • SetAttackTime

      Parameters:
